security: This document contains information about the AMBUD program and associated dependency payments, including names and personal information of individuals receiving these payments. Releasing this information could endanger these individuals and compromise ongoing or future operations. Additionally, revealing the structure and processes of AMBUD could provide adversaries with insights into intelligence operations. Specific details include: 'AMBUD monthly dependent payments effective with the March 1967 payment. Also included for indexing is a listing (pages 28-30) of the Principal Parties for whom 201 numbers are not available at JMWAVE.'
summary: This document pertains to the AMBUD program, covering dependency payments, transfer of survivor benefits, and indexing information, including a listing of authorized payees and principal parties without 201 numbers at JMWAVE.
summary_one_paragraph: The document consists of multiple dispatches and memos related to the CIA's AMBUD program. It discusses actions concerning dependency payments to individuals like Silvia Heredia, widow of Jorge Fundora, and responses to requests for additional funds. The material includes a status report on the transfer of AMBUD survivor benefit payments to the Bureau of Employee Compensation (BEC), and also lists authorized payees for AMBUD monthly dependent payments effective March 1967, and principal parties without 201 numbers at JMWAVE. One dispatch details a request for biographic information on Caridad Rodriguez.
title: Various Documents Relating to the AMBUD Program and Dependency Payments
